title: Generative Models in Active Inference
description: Understanding generative models as internal simulations of the world in Active Inference agents.
learning_objectives: Define generative models in Active Inference context
Implement temporal models for sequential prediction

content.overview: Generative models in Active Inference are internal simulations that agents use to predict the consequences of their actions. They encode beliefs about how observations are generated and guide both perception and behavior.

components: Likelihood: p(x|θ) - how observations depend on hidden states
Prior: p(θ) - beliefs about hidden states
Posterior: p(θ|x) - updated beliefs after observations
